result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew Feliciano was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(1)(a).
  • Attempt Attempt 1st-Degree Intentional Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.01(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$422.54 owed to the Crime Victim Compensation Program.
**3/5/2015  restitution set at zero to victim.  Restitution of $422.52 previously ordered remains the same.

AS TO EACH COUNT:  Pay all costs, surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge.
AS TO RESTITUTION AND ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be collected by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) Wis. Stats.  Any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.  Credit for 396 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain GED or HSED.  Seek and maintain full time employment.

No illegal drugs.  No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No contact with Uriel V.

Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.   Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to include:  those as listed.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.  Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.  Credit for 396 days.

superMiscConds.notes: SAME  conditions  as listed on count one.

Defendant Matthew Feliciano in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Matthew Feliciano in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim failing to appear, court set restitution at zero ($).  The original restitution of $422.52 owed to Crime Victim Compensation Fund remains the same.  No further action taken.

Defendant Matthew Feliciano in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Matthew Feliciano in custody.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Sworn as Interpreter:  Ismael Maldonado.   Additional statements by:  Uriel V. and Fernando F.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.    Court ordered restitution in the amount of $422.54 owed to the Crime Victim Compensation Program.
Restitution to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats.  Any balance due as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.  
PSI addressed; additions and corrections made.

COUNT 1: Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of  imprisonment of 14 YEARS, concurrent with any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is  10 YEARS with credit for 396 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 4 YEARS.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Obtain GED or HSED.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*No contact with Uriel V.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
COUNT 2:  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of  imprisonment of 25 YEARS, concurrent with any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is  18 YEARS with credit for 396 days
time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 7 YEARS.
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
  
*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*Obtain GED or HSED.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
*No contact with Uriel V.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison wages, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does not qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.  Restitution hearing scheduled for March 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Matthew Feliciano not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Sentencing hearing scheduled for 01-30-2015 at 08:30 am.
SUBPOENA
COUNTS 1 and 2:  GUILTY

Jury panel in court.   At the hour of 10:15 the jury returned and, by their foreperson, brought in a verdicts of GUILTY which were then read.  As to Count 1, as to whether the defendant committed the crime of First Degree Reckless Injury while using a dangerous weapon, the jury answered YES.  

Court polled and discharged the jury.  

Verdict received and filed.  Court granted state's motion for judgment on the verdict and denied defense motion for judgments not withstanding the verdict.  Court ordered entry of judgments of conviction.  PSI ordered.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.   Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Matthew Feliciano in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Matthew Feliciano in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Metz sworn to take charge of the jury.  Video played for the jurors.  Jury continued deliberating.

Jury in box at 2:27 p.m.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate jurors selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:39 p.m. to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies Debra Walls and Bryan Fox who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury in the box at 4:44 p.m.  Court recessed for the evening.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for 11-13-2014 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Matthew Feliciano in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Matthew Feliciano in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury in box at 9:01 a.m.  Trial proceeded.  City of Milwaukee Police Detective Scott Schmitz resumes the stand.  Jury out of box at 9:07 a.m.  Jury in box at 9:17 a.m.  Exhibit #12 and #13 marked.  Exhibit #9 and #11 received.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box at 9:39 a.m.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Court holds colloquey with defendant regarding right to testify.  Jury in the box at 10:08 a.m.  Sworn for defense: Matthew Feliciano.  Jury out of box at 11:05 a.m.  Defendant refreshes his memory by viewing Exhibit #9.  Jury in box at 11:17 a.m.  Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box at 11:25 a.m.  Instructions conference held.  Court recessed for lunch.
from ADA Hanna Kolberg regarding discovery, received and filed.

Case recalled later same day, same appearances.  The offer of Exhibit #3 and #4 is withdrawn.  Spanish Interpreter Yvon Roustan is sworn for the next witness.  Jury in box at 2:04 p.m.  Uriel V. resumes the stand.  Exhibit #6 and #5 received.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Detectives James Campbell and Edward Chaim.  Exhibit #7 received.  Parties stipulate to contents inside of Exhibit #7.  Jury out of box at 3:18 p.m.  Jury in box at 3:37 p.m.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Detective Scott Schmitz.  Exhibit #8 received.  Jury out of box at 4:35 p.m.  Defense motion for mistrial is denied.  Jury in box at 4:53 p.m.  Court instructs the panel to disregard the last answer.  Jury out of box at 4:54 p.m.  Court ordered case adjourned for continuation of jury trial in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for 11-12-2014 at 08:45 am.

Defendant Matthew Feliciano in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Matthew Feliciano in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury in the box at 9:04 a.m.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Milwaukee Police Office Kevin Panfil.  Jury out of box at 9:35 a.m.  Spanish Interpreter Sarah Guzman sworn for the next witness.  Jury in box at 9:53 a.m.  Sworn for the state:  Uriel V.  Jury out of box at 10:00 a.m.  Jury in box at 10:30 a.m.  Exhibit #1 and #2 received.  Exhibit #4 and #3 objected to by the defense.  Jury out of box at 11:28 a.m.  Sidebars are placed on the record.  Defense request that Exhibit #3 be excluded is denied.  Court ordered case adjourned to 1:30 p.m. for continuation of jury trial.

Defendant Matthew Feliciano in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Matthew Feliciano in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:33 p.m.   
Fourteen (14) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Jury out of box at 4:15 p.m.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Jury in box at 4:33 p.m.  Court instructed jury.  Jury out of box at 4:43 p.m.  Court ordered case adjourned for jury trial in Branch 26.  Jury trial scheduled for 11-11-2014 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on November 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Michael L. Chernin in court, defendant Matthew Feliciano not in court, in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Jury trial scheduled for 11-10-2014 at 01:30 pm.
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed with court.

Defendant Matthew Feliciano in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Defendant Matthew Feliciano in custody.  Hanna R. Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final pretrial held.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial on 9-22-14, 9:00 a.m.
Undated letter from Fernando F. received and filed

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Siefert.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Pocan, Br. 26. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 9/12/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 9/22/2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 26.

Defendant Matthew Feliciano in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
The State just received and turned over 4 supplemental police reports on todays date. Court grants joint request to adjourn the jury trial. Branch 15 does not have any available trial dates prior to rotation.   Parties advised effective August 2, 2014, this case will be reassigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47, Room 629 of the Courthouse.
Case in court for final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 06/16/2014 in Branch 15.

Defendant Matthew Feliciano in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Defendant Matthew Feliciano in custody.  Karyn E Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to add Count 2: Attempt First Degree Intentional Homicide, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 940.01(1)(a), 939.50(3)(a), 939.32, a Class B Felony.  Amended Information received and filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty to Count 2.

Attorney Michael L Chernin in court, defendant Matthew Feliciano not in court, in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 5/22/2014 at 8:30 am and JURY TRIAL on 6/16/2014 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.

Attorney Michael L Chernin in court, defendant Matthew Feliciano not in court, in custody.  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Courthouse was closed on 1/28. Defense counsel needs to speak with the District Attorney. Case calendared for STATUS on 2/14/2014 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Matthew Feliciano in court with attorney Michael L Chernin.  Defendant Matthew Feliciano in custody.  Danielle Chojnacki for  Karyn E. Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.    Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 28, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with URIEL V-M., JUVENILE G.V., THEIR FAMILIES, RESIDENCES OR WORKPLACES.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION for DRUG TESTING.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Matthew Feliciano in court with attorney Terese M Dick.  Defendant Matthew Feliciano in custody.  Nathaniel E. Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WATTS, Branch 15.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
